title: Riven now still sits at a 56% winrate with a 60% on her mains
body:
There are no nerfs on the horizon, not even news of one.

Conqueror is beyond settled in. The nerfs affected other champs far more than her. A """high skill floor""" champ with a """high skill cap""" should not be sitting at 56% winrates for 3 fucking patches. This is beyond inexcusable, especially considering she has a 15% playrate toplane. For those of you who don't have any idea the asinine nature of that statement, I'll spell it out:

#Toplane has _the_ largest roster in the game currently and still even finds champions from mid to migrate there as well every so often. Meaning Riven has to beat out far more champions than any other role and **_still_** has the highest playrate top.

Nerf this fucking cancer ridden champion already. There is literally no excuse anymore besides "We're going to remove Spear of Shojin and see how that affects her". That is the literal _only_ excusable reason.

Edit: Since it's too hard to just quickly google statistics (or even just read past boards topics on this): https://lolalytics.com/ranked/worldwide/platinum/plus/champion/Riven/

https://lolalytics.com/ranked/worldwide/diamond/plus/champion/Riven/

https://lolalytics.com/ranked/worldwide/master/plus/champion/Riven/

Winrate continues to climb the higher in ranked you go, averaging around 56% in higher tiers.

Despite the problematic tone here, OneMustFall is right - there is a genuinely serious and valid point here in terms of analytics.

A 56% winrate in Master+ doesn't mean that this is the winrate in equal ELO matchups at that level.  

Because higher-tier players don't exclusively play at their own tier, divisional winrates don't even out to 50%.

And, as a general rule, higher-tier players tend to win more games.

*Everyone* needs to be careful versus a good {{champion:92}}!  I don't know that this is a bad thing;  a good champion piloted by a top player should always have a chance to win the lane, ideally.  

That being said, I don't agree that some of the matches you've listed are auto-wins for her in lane phase.

I will play {{champion:75}}, {{champion:17}}, and {{champion:50}} into {{champion:92}} any day of the week.   {{champion:17}} and  {{champion:50}} have enough range, CC and mobility that they simply shouldn't be getting caught out by her full combo.

As for  {{champion:75}} - sure, I got killed by  {{champion:92}} once last time I played that matchup in lane phase.   But after that?  As soon as I got {{item:3025}} and 100-150 stacks, she couldn't all-in anymore, and if she can't all-in she can hardly lane -  and once {{champion:75}} gets ahead, he often stays that way.  He doesn't lose the game just because he doesn't get the first kill;  all he needs to succeed usually is 15+ stacks per minute and one or two items, which can be gotten versus her pretty easily - and we won that game pretty convincingly.

All this being said, I do still think she needs a nerf, just based on the fact that she seems to have 51-52% winrates or better against most of the field right now. In my experience against Nasus' (D4-D3, no idea what that means since ranked changed to no D5) if you hard shove first wave and have it bounce back the Nasus is dead. Either they will overextend for a creep and get chunked or killed, or be zoned out of even the exp from the wave. If you're playing up on Nasus' side of the creep wave he doesn't have many options. You can sacrifice both of your farm, but as long as only the Riven gets the exp they win. Nasus can go for an E max to try and keep some lane pressure but they'll be auto pushing and have no stacks. The Riven player can get this zone started 100% of games with hard shoving the first wave. Only way for Nasus to have a real chance is the jungler coming to break the freeze.

At 6, the Nasus for the first time has some laning pressure from his ult, but it means little into Riven early. If Riven EW buffers they can space out the wither duration with Q dashes and evade his ult. Q onto him, see if he pops it then dip until it's over. Continue to zone him until the ult's back. It's even easier with swifties.

While IBG can be a good bandaid solution to the terrible Nasus laning, it doesn't help as much as other items. Into Riven specifically, Nasus stands the best chance rushing righteous glory and getting a randuins omen second. He has no problem killing the Riven at 2 items as long as he can stick to her for his ult duration. By then you'll most likely be in the midgame and teamfighting, but you should be beating the Riven in any 1v1 until later in the game when her full build is better than yours.

I bring up this point because, for the longest time, anytime someone would bring up Riven being obnoxious in the higher elos, people would throw in that she isn’t a pro pickup and only good up to Challenger. Except now, she has been getting picked up in pros, and has been doing very well, especially now that Urgot has dropped off. 

Now, there’s the question of why Riven is so much more obnoxious this time around. Most of us hold her extra power is due to Conqueror and Spear of Shojin, so start there. Get rid of the Awakened Dragon passive, as it’s a problem here and when it was on ER as Essence Flare. Only a few champions can take the item and use it incredibly well (Riven, Jax), while it may as well not exist for others. Other items can be this way as well (cough cough, Manamune), but this one is currently a big issue. In Rivens case, Shojin allows her to have incredibly low CDs on her dash and shield, which makes fighting her a quick loss most of the time.

Then there’s Conqueror, her best rune, that she stacks incredibly quickly to unlock the true damage and the healing. This makes her strong into a good chunk of matchups, as she racks up good burst damage to deal with her opponent, and Conqueror’s heal and true damage makes her actually at least decent against tanks, if not good.

The answer may not be in Riven’s kit, but in what she builds, but the fact of the matter is that she’s sitting at a higher playrate, a pretty good winrate given her touted as “high skill” and her playrate, and now that she’s also seeing play and success in pros, *should* be signalling that something is wrong.

For the record, when a good number of other champs have been strong in both solo and pro, they get the bat. Some escape, but many have gotten the bat, including the “high skill” champs.

Buff top lane tanks.  Heavy armor CC tanks countered Riven back in the day when even Taric could be brought top to deal with her.  Now, you might argue that tanks do not counter Riven, and in the current meta that may be true because non-support tanks are weak overall.  It's important to keep in mind that counter matchups depend on how strong the individual champions and classes are.  If a champion or class is severely underpowered, it can't hold its own to counter hardly anything.  Back when solo lane tanks were viable, Riven wasn't often able to kill them in laning so she couldn't snowball out of control and then she would be CCed by her tank rival when she tried to join the fray in teamfights.

Heavy Frontliners > Mobile/Stealthy Opportunists > Squishy Backliners > Heavy Frontliners
Riven is a mobile opportunist ^
